file_content.text: Ahem... hello again, Captain. I understand Skavak escaped. I was, ah, truly sorry to hear that.
I still have your head. Got anything useful to trade for it?
We got off on the wrong foot, didn't we? I apologize if I was rude before.
You must understand, the head of Darth Bandon is a priceless artifact. He was the Sith Lord who murdered one of Alderaan's noblest sons.
Centuries ago, Trask Ulgo bravely sacrificed himself in combat with Darth Bandon. Trask's martyrdom saved the Galactic Republic.
What keeps the head fresh-looking after all these years?
This head is well-preserved.
When Darth Bandon ultimately fell in battle, Sith acolytes preserved and enshrined his head. Despicable people.
You nobles will make a hero out of any screwup, won't you?
In other words, he lost.
Trask's death was a noble sacrifice. It allowed a powerful Force user to live who eventually went on to destroy the evil Darth Malak.
I don't care about your history.
Blah, blah, blah.
No, of course you don't. You're an offworlder. Let me put this in simpler terms.
Yes, I see that. I'm simply attempting to explain why the head is so important.
Alderaan's current king is of the Ulgo family bloodline, and he reveres his ancestor Trask.
The remains of Trask's murderer will be the perfect peace offering to our king. House Alde must have your head! Er, so to speak....
I'll trade this head for a new Arkanian hyperdrive.
Give me what I need.
But I only had the one! And the Arkanian engineer who crafted it is long dead.
This is a pretty weird peace offering.
You people are strange.
Had you been raised on Alderaan, you would understand.
You don't have to understand the subtleties of our politics. Just know that it's vital we reach an agreement.
This head is going to cost you a lot.
Prepare to pay a fortune.
I was afraid you'd say that.
Any payment in credits I give you for the head now will have to come from my own funds. I'm not a wealthy man.
Please, I beg you. For the love of peace and posterity, please accept my offer of what little I possess.
Oh, all right.
You are very gracious indeed and a credit to your profession.
I must deliver this head to Baron Alde at once. Thank you for your understanding. Farewell.
I'll take that and your nicest museum piece.
I want a souvenir.
That would violate every tenet of the Noble Curator's Code. If anyone found out... the shame of it!
If I don't get that head, the shame will be worse. Here, take this. It's from the late Burgan period. Quite valuable.
I don't know how I'll sleep at night, but at least the baron has his head. Goodbye.
Keep your money--peace and posterity are enough for me.
You can have it for free.
You--you truly mean it? Oh, thank you! Thank you so much!
Mercy to a fool brings good luck.
That was downright charitable of you, Captain. I hope this idiot appreciates it.
I would kiss you, Captain, but I'm certain you would strike me for it.
I must deliver this relic to the baron at once. Thank you again!
You must hurry to the spaceport. Stop Skavak before he escapes.
Guided tours of House Alde's Royal Museum are closed until further notice.
I have nothing against offworld visitors, but please leave or I'll be forced to call security.
Scoot along and don't be a bother. Otherwise, you'll answer to security.
Do you want this head in a jar or not?
I most certainly do not! Get that disgusting thing out of my sight.
I mean, really--what sort of buffoon brings a counterfeit head and expects payment?
House Alde has already obtained the head of Darth Bandon, thank you very much. It was genetically authenticated by one of my conservators yesterday.
Maybe this Darth Bandon had two heads?
It could still be real.
Don't be ridiculous. Yours is obviously a forgery.
This is the real head, stupid.
How dare you. House Alde does not make mistakes.
Not only are you an idiot, your people are incompetent.
Your assistant is wrong.
How dare you!
Kaddreth? Kaddreth, come here!
Yes, Noble Curator? How may I serve your impeccable rectitude?
Where is Neva? I want her to run the genetic authenticator on this head and prove it's a fake.
I haven't seen Neva since she authenticated the other head yesterday, Noble Curator. I sent a message to her holo, but she never replied.
I need you to test this head for me, Kaddreth.
Can you authenticate this?
I'd really rather not. It's quite ugly.
I smell a womp rat.
She's the problem.
This estate is vermin-free, I assure you.
Describe this Neva to me so I can end her miserable existence.
I'll kill her.
Oh, my stars, no! She's such a lovely young lady.
Kaddreth, perform a genetic authentication on this head at once. Compare the results to the head we received yesterday.
I beg your patience, Noble Curator. This process will take some time....
I'm afraid we have a slight problem. This head is a one-hundred percent genetic match for the Sith Lord Darth Bandon.
I retested the head Neva verified yesterday, and it does not appear anywhere in the genetic authenticator's database.
Somebody owes me an apology.
Say "I'm sorry," Peema.
And someone owes me an explanation....
Tell me who delivered that fake head.
Who brought the other one?
The same man who promised he could obtain it....
Hand over my payment, you morons.
So reward me, already.
That poses something of a problem. We, ahem, already gave it to the other man....
Captain Skavak? This is Noble Curator Peema Ahuff speaking.
I demand that you return the Arkanian hyperdrive at once. The head you bought it with is a counterfeit!
Sorry, Peemie. I have a strict "no refunds" policy. Heya, Captain. You're a little late to the party.
I should've known you were behind this, Skavak.
Now everything makes sense.
I promised you'd regret crossing me.
Where'd you dig up a counterfeit head, Skavak?
How did you pull off the fake?
On a battlefield, where else? People will buy anything if the case is fancy enough.
I'm coming to get you, Skavak.
And you're going to die.
Just give me a few minutes to clean up--I wasn't expecting company.
Hope you don't mind, Peemie, but Neva's taking an early retirement. She's too gorgeous for life in a museum.
What? You... you... menace! You corrupted that girl!
It wasn't that hard, trust me.
Enough talk! Let's kill him!
Easy there, scruffy. I see your taste in friends hasn't improved, Captain.
At least I have friends.
You should talk.
Ooh, that hurts. I'm gonna cry myself to sleep on that bed of credits I'll get from Nok Drayen's treasure.
I think you should get to know Bowdaar better.
You'll meet him in person.
No thanks. Wouldn't want to catch any fleas.
Bowdaar, shut up and let me handle this.
Pipe down, Wookiee.
Swat him on the nose with some rolled up flimsiplast. I hear that works.
You won't have much use for women once me and Hewie get done with you, Skavak.
You still got that giant vibrosword? What are you trying to compensate for, kid?
Corso doesn't have anything to prove.
Nothing--Corso's the best.
Forgive me, I didn't know you two had gotten so close.
He just wants his Torchy back.
Lack of a blaster.
Sorry, Corso, but that's a grownup weapon. You'd just put out your eye.
Nobody talks to Skavak but me, got it?
Back off, Corso.
You two know how to make a guy feel loved.
Oh, I wish I had a holo of your face right now, Captain. That expression is just priceless. Have fun eating my vapor trails....
This is unthinkable! Skavak has committed a grievous affront to House Alde!
I was promised payment for this head, your worship.
What about me?
The hyperdrive was to be your payment. It's an extraordinary apparatus, custom-built by one of Arkania's most brilliant engineers.
Send some guards after him--fast!
Alert the authorities.
I'll inform House Organa's spaceport security, but I can't guarantee they will intervene.
You idiots.
Now, really--this is no time for insults!
Skavak received the Arkanian hyperdrive at the spaceport yesterday. If he's still there, he must not have finished installing it.
Skavak cannot leave Alderaan without a functioning hyperdrive. Hurry--catch him before he escapes!
House Alde has many treasures. You are not allowed to touch any of them.
